info.name: Spinal cord, dorsal root
info.description: A dorsal root is AKA a posterior or sensory root of the spinal cord. It contains the axons of sensory neurons whose cell bodies are located in the ipsilateral dorsal root ganglion (or sensory ganglion) on the respective spinal nerve. Â As the nerve fibers leave the ganglion, they break up into multiple divisions known as rootlets and enter the spinal cord at the dorsal lateral sulcus. These axons terminate within the spinal cord and brain stem.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/1 Sacral cord, middle
